text: Any plans to extend this limit?
Yea multi-domain publishing for a content type is an ENT only feature
<@U6W3H6YN8> I’ve known a LOT of clients who would pay a few hundred bucks a month extra for that functionality on their pro plan
Good to know, thanks
Is there a way to have a form dropdown which would add a user to a specific list upon form submission?
You could check the final value of the selection in a workflow then put them in the list based on that value
Or make the list criteria based on that value
Agreed with <@U4RP6AGV9> we have clients that would pay for this as well
if it’s a smart list - static though, you’d have to add them
has anyone heard anything about this?

I directly asked about this during the HS dev AMA at Inbound. They stated that they’ve been planning and strategizing how to implement smart content for custom modules but it sounded like there are no immediate updates in the near future to add support. They want to do it right, and it’s such a complex thing to do that it’s really hard to do right but really easy to get it wrong.
thanks!

Somewhat similar to what Christine posted in <#C2YH119N2|hubl> this morning, but is there a way to do a find and replace on links throughout the site?

We just rebranded to <http://zenpilot.com|zenpilot.com> and need to go back through all the old blog posts, etc. and update internal links from <http://doinbound.com/|doinbound.com/> to <http://zenpilot.com/|zenpilot.com/> — <@U25C65C3S> emphasized how important this was when they switched URL’s…so I’m just wondering if there’s a shortcut to doing this now haha.

btw, they’ve got a great case study post on their process and awesome results if anyone’s going through the same process and hasn’t seen that yet :thumbsup:
Thanks guys!

not quite what you’re wanting but I did in the past use a HubDB to do find and replace of certain terms throughout a site. it also allowed them to do things like turn a product name into a link to the product.

This was done by basically checking if the input of each field used in a post contained any of the words in the HubDB and replacing those.
worked great for what my client needed. but it’s not like a real find and replace the original string in the code sort of situation

got it - that’s smart, Jon. I’ll keep chewing on it for now and figure out if anything gets me close. Probably not worth too much time before we just start manually going through posts and pages, but always looking for an easier way on these tedious things haha

Yea it can be hard.

if it’s not forsure going to be on a ton of places you could do a google search for the  domain and the string you want to replace and find all those instances and manually correct it. I’d also try the HS search as it’s more live than Googles results would be

It would be pretty simple to build a simple literal find and replace tool/script that basically combed through all of your page objects JSON and replaced strings, and PUT the revised JSON back to update, but this might be kind of dangerous to blindly do
I will give it a stab and see what it looks like
It theoretically could be done through the api. Itd be taxxing and dangerous but could work
Second what jon said, I believe we’ve done similar things through the api, but its very dangerous to automate that process.
Would something like this work? {{ content.post_body|replace(‘<http://doinbound.com|doinbound.com>’ , ‘<http://zenpilot.com|zenpilot.com>’) }} <@U2MCE88GL>
you’d have to edit the templates and it’s definitely not a permanent fix, but it would serve its purpose until you found a way to go in and change them all
what <@U4RP6AGV9> said should work, I totally read the message as you needed to change the url on pages, not within blog articles.
This, of course, assuming he’s modified the base URL of all blog posts to be the new branding domain
I was assuming anything, anywhere where in a content object :speak_no_evil: wrote it, and I dont like it
Question! with HubSpot’s new search modules, is it possible to limit what shows up in search results? E.g. Have a search specific to the blog, a search for the knowledgebase, etc.?
Yes to search for blog.
dont think you can do the knowledge base part though
if you inspect the default search custom module there’s a hidden input field you can add that allows you to limit the results
theres another way via the api as well. I just don’t have a handy link to it
got it I see that, i totally worded the question wrong haha, what i mean is it it possible to filter out specific results based on a url, like only show results from /blog/…
or maybe I don’t see it in the module, i only see limit count
Valid :white_check_mark: , since the question was asked, because of how the question was asked, I assume the content was already migrated.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/content/search-for-content>
There's a `pathPrefix` argument that you could use
